TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IImageList

Docs.summary: This API supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ImageListSetIcon (IntPtr pIcon, int nLoc);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImageListSetIcon(native int pIcon, int32 nLoc) cil managed
Public Sub ImageListSetIcon (pIcon As IntPtr, nLoc As Integer)
public: void ImageListSetIcon(IntPtr pIcon, int nLoc);
abstract member ImageListSetIcon : nativeint * int -> unit

Docs.param: A value that specifies the Win32 HICON handle to the icon to set.
A value that specifies the index assigned to the entry. This is a virtual index that is internally mapped to the actual index.
Docs.summary: Enables a user to set an icon in the image list or to create an icon if it is not there.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ImageListSetStrip (int pBMapSm, int pBMapLg, int nStartLoc, int cMask);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImageListSetStrip(int32 pBMapSm, int32 pBMapLg, int32 nStartLoc, int32 cMask) cil managed
Public Sub ImageListSetStrip (pBMapSm As Integer, pBMapLg As Integer, nStartLoc As Integer, cMask As Integer)
public: void ImageListSetStrip(int pBMapSm, int pBMapLg, int nStartLoc, int cMask);
abstract member ImageListSetStrip : int * int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: Win32 HBITMAP handle to the small (16x16) icon image strip.
Win32 HBITMAP handle to the large (32x32) icon image strip.
A value that specifies the index assigned to the first image in the strip. This is a virtual index that is internally mapped to the actual index.
A value that specifies the color used to generate a mask.
Docs.summary: Enables a user to add a strip of icons to the image list using a pair of bitmaps (large and small icons), starting at a location identified by .
